results.headline: Deception and Uncertainty Feed a Murky Justice
results.summary_short: In “Reasonable Doubt,” a prosecutor thinks he has committed a fatal hit-and-run and then tries to derail the prosecution of a man fingered for the death.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Reasonable Doubt

results.headline: Drifting Closer but Never Enough
results.summary_short: “Indigo Children” centers on the summer idyll of two adolescents.

results.headline: You Have the Right to Remain Funny
results.summary_short: Kevin Hart plays a man aspiring to be a police officer, and Ice Cube plays a veteran on the force in this buddy cop comedy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ride Along

results.headline: One Good Man to Save the World
results.summary_short: Paramount reboots an action franchise, casting Chris Pine in a role previously played by Alec Baldwin, Harrison Ford and Ben Affleck.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit

results.headline: On the Trail of a Vicious Killer, Eagerly Licking Their Chops
results.summary_short: In “Big Bad Wolves,” three vigilantes hunt for a child-killer and rapist.

results.headline: Actions as Well as Prayers
results.summary_short: The documentary “Band of Sisters” explores the evolution of nuns in the United States since the Second Vatican Council in the 1960s.

results.headline: A Confused Boy Wants to Play, Even When Others Want to Fight
results.summary_short: In “When I Saw You,” a young Palestinian boy runs away from a refugee camp in 1967 and ends up with a band of volunteer soldiers preparing to fight Israelis.

results.headline: A History Lesson, Airbrushed
results.summary_short: “Generation War,” a film about early-1940s Germany, is notable for what it includes and for what it leaves out.

results.headline: Wrestlers in Leather: What More Is Required?
results.summary_short: “The Legend of Hercules,” directed by Renny Harlin, has lots of abs and Kellan Lutz as the title demigod.

results.headline: And You Thought Cockfights Were Brutal
results.summary_short: In “Raze,” abducted women are obliged to fight each other to the death if they want a loved one to survive.

results.headline: Buying Peace of Mind With a Pistol
results.summary_short: After a violent mugging, a young New York woman moves to Austin, Tex., in search of peace and security in “Loves Her Gun.”

results.headline: Everyone’s a Drag, Except That Cool New Neighbor
results.summary_short: “The Truth About Emanuel,” a difficult teenager becomes fascinated with a mysterious woman who moves in next door with her new baby.

results.headline: If Bad Things Happen, Blame the 10-Year-Old
results.summary_short: In “The Rocket,” a Laotian boy’s family faults him for the terrible circumstances they face when they are forced to relocate.

results.headline: Take Two Aspirin, Then Roll in the Mud
results.summary_short: The documentary “Grounded” claims that bare-skin contact with the earth can cure a variety of common ills.

results.headline: An Unpleasant Surprise on Taco Tuesday
results.summary_short: In “Return to Nuke ’Em High,” the consumption of, er, foodstuffs causes the glee club to mutate into a vicious gang.

results.headline: Aw, He Seemed So Nice and Sexy
results.summary_short: “Truth” focuses on a troubled young man who gives into his dark side after falling for someone he met on the Internet.

results.headline: Coming-of-Age in Wartime
results.summary_short: “In Bloom,” Georgia’s entry for the Best Foreign Language Film Oscar, tracks the lives of two girls in Tbilisi in 1992, during the newly independent country’s civil war.

results.headline: Today, a Chicken Coop; Tomorrow, the World
results.summary_short: In the documentary “If You Build It,” two activists help North Carolina students reinvent their surroundings by teaching them design and construction skills.

results.headline: A Korean Who’s More Than He Seems
results.summary_short: “The Suspect” centers on a former North Korean operative who is on the run after being framed for the murder of his boss.

results.headline: No Heavy Lifting for These Gym Rats
results.summary_short: Were you longing for a gross-out comedy about fitness centers? Do you need to see more Fabio on screen? “Dumbbells” is here.
